results.title: The Six wives of Henry VIII
results.brief_description: Few television series have attracted as much critical and public acclaim as these six triumphant plays, now preserved on video. Written by six different authors each play is a lavish and authentic dramatisation, produced with style and quality. And binding them together with his magnetic and dignified performance as the mighty monarch is Keith Michell - the definitive Henry VIII.

results.title: Catherine Parr
results.creator_credit: Naomi Capon, Mark Shivas, Ronald Travers and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
Having been forced to marry the gross and ageing King, Catherine Parr then finds herself protesting accusations of heresy. But the unpretentious Queen rises above the storm and proves to be the only wife whose courageous honesty, directness and shining intellect endear rather than anger King Henry. She is also the only wife to survive her marriage and outlive the most notorious king in history.

results.title: Catherine Howard
results.creator_credit: Naomi Capon, Mark Shivas, Ronald Travers and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
Henry VIII is enchanted by the young and beautiful Catherine Howard; she is in love with the glamorous thought of being Queen of England. But her physical distaste for the King, her vanity, immaturity, indiscretion and adultery lead her, with her lover, to a bitter end.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Naomi Capon, Mark Shivas, Ronald Travers and BBC

results.title: Anne of Cleves
results.creator_credit: John Glenister, Mark Shivas, Ronald Travers and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
The story of Henry VIII’s marriage to the rawboned Anne of Cleves is the story of an alliance between England and Germany, a pact between nations not persons, a political celebration without passionate consummation. But while the annulment of that marriage amounts to a corresponding escape from political dilemmas, it also means the parting of two close friends. Stars Keith Michell as Henry VIII.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Glenister, Mark Shivas, Ronald Travers and BBC

results.title: Jane Seymour
results.creator_credit: John Glenister, Ronald Travers and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
After his stormy and fatal relationship with Anne Boleyn, Henry VIII falls in love with her absolute antithesis - the shy and devout Jane Seymour. Calm, serene, gentle and giving, she comforts and cherishes her king with loyalty and love - she even bears him a son. But the lives of both Jane and her child soon come to a tragic end.

results.title: The Long Search
results.brief_description: Ronald Eyre hosts a series which seeks to discover the insights and truths offered by world religions in an age of over population, materialism, inflation, H-bombs and black holes.

results.title: Loose ends
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this concluding episode Ronald Eyre attempts to answer questions such as “Is religion about theology?”, “Is God dead?”, “Do all religions say the same thing?” In a program filled with such questions and many more personal ones besides, he revisits some of the crucial moments in his search including his visits to Romania, the Buddhist monks and the taoist funeral, concluding that in order to find true religion, one first has to find oneself.

results.title: West meets east
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this penultimate program Ronald Eyre visits the alternative communities of San Francisco, where westerners are searching for something to replace traditional religion, or the religion of science and progress, which seems to have replaced religion in the accepted sense in much of western society. The fundamental question he asks in this program is “Is God dead and did science kill him, and is science an adequate explanation of reality?” He talks to Theodore Roszak about the quest for meaning, and to noted physicists and philosophers, about the growing indadequacy of science to explain. Touching briefly on various manifestations of this search - biofeedback, sikhism, SAGE and the new physics, he concludes that the search itself is positive, even if the finding is sometimes shallow and negative.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to Taiwan Ronald Eyre looks at Chinese religion and finds that the Chinese are Confucians, Taoists, Buddhists or can be all three at once. He explores the concept of yin and yan and the harmony which comes when good and evil are combined in balance. He takes his journey from a look at the local gods to the philosophy of the three accepted religions. The three main aims of the Chinese seem to be to live a long time, to have enough money and to have children, and it is from this that the importance of ancestors derive. He attends a village opera performance, a taoist funeral and explores a new temple which seems to include all three religions.

results.title: Zulu Zion
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to South Africa Ronald Eyre looks at the ways Christianity has evolved into an almost completely different religion, with an emphasis on dreams, purification, healing and the power of the holy spirit. Black Africans separated from the land search to replace these roots in God and the three different Christian sects which are explored here - the Zionists, the Lutherans and the Nazarites, all in their different ways have combined traditional African religion with Christianity. A fascinating look at how two different religions can merge and evolve into something quite unique and alive.
